Job Title: Plant Maintenance Manager

Location: San Leandro, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Other

Description:
Our client is seeking a Maintenance Manager to support our Organic Materials Composting Facility (OMCF) located in San Leandro, California. The Maintenance Manager position supervises the plant's Maintenance Team.This position's responsibilities include conducting planned, preventative, and reactive maintenance, supervising the Maintenance Team, performing time-sensitive site inspections and audits, procuring tools and equipment necessary, and maintaining all required maintenance documentation.Job Duties and ResponsibilitiesThe Maintenance Manager reports to the Plant Manager and will be responsible for the supervision of the Maintenance Team. Duties are:- Manage external buildings/service maintenance contracts (pat testing, fire alarms, compressor, etc.)- Plan and perform planned preventative maintenance on all plant mechanical equipment.- Provide mentoring and training for the Maintenance Team to build additional maintenance skill sets.- Respond to equipment malfunctions effectively and efficiently.- Ensure good maintenance housekeeping practices in high-hazard environments.- Supervise daily, weekly, and monthly preventative maintenance inspections.- Perform and/or supervise bearing and component replacements and repair for conveyor belts, gearboxes, pumps, fans, and all other mechanical systems in and around the plant.- Comply with environmental safety and health procedures and policies established and ensure that supervised employees remain in compliance.- Adhere to all standard operating procedures as trained.- Support and monitor contractors on site.- Maintain critical inventory (i.e., fuel, oil, hydraulic fluid, fall protection, PPE, monitoring equipment, and spare parts).- Work with engineering drawings.- Operate forklifts, boom lifts, and scissor lifts.Qualifications:- High school diploma or equivalent GED required.- 3 years of maintenance experience in manufacturing environments required.- 2 years of experience in a supervisory capacity in a manufacturing environment required.- Experience managing teams.- Professional attitude.- Willing to follow all Standard Operating Procedures as trained.- Respecting all safety procedures in and around the plant as trainedAdditional Skills Desired:- Solid Waste or Environmental Service Industries experience.- Mechanical background.- Engineering background.- Hydraulic, pneumatic, PLC, control panel and I/O fault-finding, and inverter experience.- Leadership and supervisory experience.- Excellent communication and report writing skills.- Computer literate and fluent with Microsoft Office Suite or related software to complete reports and logs.- Ability to quickly learn production operations and machinery.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
